>So said Robert Brown on 4/24/2003 --------------------
>In my opinion, yo=
u should test every public method of a class.  The
>reason I have for this =
is that even though you know that the method
>turns around and calls anothe=
r method that is tested somewhere else,
>that may not always be the case, a=
nd you don't know that the call is
>coded correctly either, or that the und=
erlying class/method hasn't been
>changed to return something that is unexp=
ected.
<snip />

If a programmer changes the implementation from trivial to=
 nontrivial, add some tests. If a programmer change the implementation from=
 nontrivial to trivial, remove some tests. That may seem wasteful, but in m=
y opinion, testing trivial code is more wasteful over time.

Take care.


J=
